articles.title: Solar storm creates history? Powerful strike sparks RARE auroras in Peru - HT Tech
articles.description: In what is believed to be one of the first instances of aurora lights in low-latitude regions, the weekend solar storm triggered extremely rare red auroras in Peru, which is located just under the equator.
articles.content: There are some things we know about solar storms. First is that they strike the Earth near the polar region, due to the magnetic field lines of our planet. We also know that this is why auroras are p… [+2146 chars]
